author: Staff Reporter
text:
Twenty four flying squads have been formed and as many check-posts erected in the district to monitor poll code violations, including movement of cash, and intensify surveillance during the Assembly elections.

Talking to media persons here on Monday, Superintendent of Police A. Saravanan said that additional force had been deployed at all check-posts for effective monitoring. Round- the-clock surveillance had been intensified. Cash carried without supporting document would be seized. But a receipt would be issued.

If there were any poll code violations at marriage halls, cases would be filed against the owner of the property and cadres concerned.

Cases had been registered against 418 persons as a preventive measure, Mr. Saravanan added.
title: 24 flying squads formed
